options.content:
# Welcome to Grafana 7.4

Grafana v7.4 is adds many new enhancements to visualizations, transformations, tracing, security, auditing & more. This dashboard highlights 
some of the new visualization capabilities. 

[Read the what's new article](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/whatsnew/whats-new-in-v7-4/)  | 
[Download](https://grafana.com/grafana/download/beta)

## Interpolation modes

The new time series panel brings a new interpolation mode
where you can choose between.
* Linear
* Smooth
* Step before
* Step after (same as old staircase option)

# Performance

The new graph component is many times faster than the 
old graph panel, capable of rendering thousands of data points and many series
at 30 frames per second.

## Soft min and max

Auto **Min** and **Max** can make small variations look much bigger than they  are. This can be fixed by setting **Min** & **Max**. 
This creates a new problem when spikes in the data occur. Because the 
**Min** and **Max** are hard the full spike cannot be seen. 

The new _Time series_ panel has options for **Soft min** and **Soft max** that can solve 
this. With these new options you can control the default range of the axis but also allow going
beyond this range when the data does. 

You can combine both the existing standard option **Min** and **Max** and the new **Soft min**
 and **Soft max** to define both soft and hard limits.

spec.title: Soft min 0, soft max 30, with spike

options.content:
## Richer display options

The new time series panel supports more control over lines, fill gradients that 
work for both line, area graphs & bars.

spec.title: Value mappings that work on y-axis

options.content:
## Value mappings

Standard field config value mappings work and will affect the y-axis.

## Multiple Y-Axes

With the new panel you can have more than 2 y-axes!
